reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very clean, food is excellent, service is very good.The location is very good. I've been twice already to this hotel and I would definitely return.
reviews.title: Exellent location with large rooms

reviews.text: As other travelers have noted, the Regal Pacific is somewhat outdated. The rooms could use a design refresh, and the restaurant's 1980's decor is straight out of a Duran Duran music video.
reviews.title: Unparalleled service more than makes up for outdated design

reviews.text: But in spite of its aesthetic shortcomings, the Regal Pacific is an excellent place to stay in Santiago. The service was nothing short of perfect, with staff glad to help with anything and everything. The breakfast spread is fantastic -- including fresh blackberries and strawberries -- and the hotel restaurant serves a mean Chilean sea bass.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: So, if you're after some old fashioned charm and don't mind stepping back in time to the mid-1980's, give the R.P a try.
reviews.title: A good location, attentive staff and good rooms and resturant

reviews.text: It should be noted, however, that the Regal Pacific's beds/mattresses are very comfortable and do appear to have been replaced since Bon Jovi's heyday.
reviews.title: Great location for business: competitive rates
We stayed in July 2009 and loved it.
reviews.text: I stayed at the Regal Pacific while traveling on business in October. While this hotel is not super modern, I must say that the service was outstanding. The staff at the hotel is really friendly and always aiming to please their guests. The food at the hotel restaurant was also fantastic!

I do not know if the owners of the Regal Pacific chose "being" in Las Condes and not in "Santiago" on purpose to reach a higher position in the rankings. They are in the same area of other hotels (like the Hyatt), against which they do not compete. Las Condes, being probably a different municipality, is definitely Santiago...
reviews.title: They are in Santiago, should compare themselves with Santiago hotels...

reviews.text: That said, the hotel is a nice one, in need of some refurbishing. The rooms are ample and the breakfast is fine (i do not know the price, but don´t expect a five stars buffet). The service is very attentive.
reviews.title: Older in style - but very comfortable

reviews.text: So, if you find it for a good price, and need to be in Las Condes area of Santiago (where many companies have their headquarters), it can be a good option.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has obviously been around for a while, but the rooms were large and very comfortable. I had a suite that had a small kitchen/bar area, lounge areas seperate from the bed, which when travelling for business as I was made a big difference. The conference facilities while good were standard. Its in a good location, opposite a large multi story shopping complex and within walking distance of main restaurant area.
reviews.title: Good hotel good food good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regal Pacific is a very colonial style with good and sympathetic staff, with comfortable rooms and all business support.
reviews.title: Upstairs, down stairs?

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of spending a week here in January, the staff are all friendly with a good level of English. The food in the restaurant is great quality and beautifully presented. Rooms could do with a bit of an update, but they are clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent food, service and staff. Location not great for sightseeing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is great if you are on business at the nearby Offices, not a place to stay for sightseeing, it's a bit of a trip to the city.
reviews.title: Excellent location, dated decor, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was the first time we visited Santiago. This hotel is literally right next to the subway/metro station. It's very convenient if you are the explorer type and don't mind getting around using the subway. Across the street of the hotel have a couple of decent shopping malls and little stores/cafes. One block from the hotel is a large supermarket (Lider). Very convenient location. However, it's not very close to all the tourist attractions, which are mostly located in the Santiago downtown area. It was fine for us as it's only about US$1 for one way subway ticket to go anywhere...
reviews.title: Good Location and Room - Poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a bit small. Lobby is small. Reception area is small. It's also a bit dated. It still has excellent service though - like, they still have nightly turn down service that most hotels don't have.... or give you a shoe cloth to clean your shoes... which I rarely see in hotels nowadays. Hotel breakfast is okay. They have a few hot items (eggs, pancakes, sausages, bacon), some fruits (strawberries will not be replaced once it's emptied... which other fruits will be replaced), toasts, some ham, juice, tea, coffee, etc.
reviews.title: Fabulous room

reviews.title: The 4.5 star rating is misleading. It is a good 3 star hotel.
